main event: A bright, flashing light was observed in the sky over Guam, disappearing at an elevation of about 5 degrees above the horizon.
interesting points: The object was observed for 1-2 hours, appearing as a 'fiery magnitude star' and then suddenly disappearing.
The sighting location was at latitude 11-41-N and longitude 144-54-E.
The object was observed through binoculars and appeared as a point source with slow movement.
No air contacts were detected by radar.
The object was believed to be a satellite.
